examples.text: She was pale and had a feeble pulse.
The patient appears feeble and emaciated.

definitions.definition: not effective; not showing energy or effort

examples.text: She made a feeble attempt to explain what had happened.
Don't be so feeble! Tell her you don't want to go.
He told a few feeble jokes.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French fieble, earlier fleible, from Latin flebilis ‘lamentable’, from flere ‘weep’.
